content:
I'm about to file a bunch of issues regarding the headless use case, mostly from #3346. Many of these things is really about platform integration: devices which are attached while already started, how to initiate stop from outside, etc.

There is also #3349. The solution for this is to use Dbus. I would say this is a no-brainer, using dbus instead of lock files resolves all otherwise tricky corner cases. Now, since this pulls in dbus anyway, we could of course use it also for other things.

Now, dbus is linux only. OTOH, I don't really see a windows or macos headless device, so such functionality might be linux only anyway as I see it.

But that's just me. Thoughts?

@Pavel Kalian @Dave Register
